DOMDocument.versionInfo: Saved by Adobe Flash Macintosh 11.0 build 489

Actionscript.script: import flash.events.MouseEvent; stop(); start.addEventListener(MouseEvent.CLICK, startClicked); function startClicked(event:MouseEvent):void { var snd:StartSound = new StartSound(); snd.play(); gotoAndPlay(1, 'Intro'); }

p.span: Your name is Xiao, you are a worker at the electronic factory Foxconn in China, Shenzhen.
Your salary is only half of the cost of living which forces you to work overtime, a lot of overtime!
Whatever you do, keep up your production quota, avoid breathing in poisonous chemicals, ask no questions and stay in line!
You have produced xxx nbr of products and earned yyy score. For a couple of days you have tried out the life of a factory worker in China.

(Picture of the posion product) - In the Wintek factory workers used the poisonous chemical n-hexane to clean touch screens. Workers got really sick and a number of them were taken into hospital on October the 26th 2010. Earlier alcohol was used but it was replaced by n-hexane as it evaporates faster and hence can increase the production rate.

(Picture of the clock) - In the Foxconn factory (which manufactures e.g. iPad) monthly overtime working hours amounts to 120 hours during the peak production time. The local labour law says the maximum is 36 overtime working hours per month. The production target is usually 5000 pieces per day. Although Foxconn claims workers have a 10-minute break every 2 hours, a worker interviewed says there are no breaks in her department at all.

(Picture of manager) - Harsh treatment from managers is common at the Foxconn factory. Workers are reminded they should obey all instructions by superiors without questioning. Sometimes management sets traps to test the workers. For example management can take away a component of a product. If the worker concerned cannot discover the flaw, he/she will be punished. Public humiliation is a common punishment.
